shortdesc.ph: Callback when the virtual metronome state changes.
Occurs when the state of the virtual metronome changes.

p.codeblock: final void Function(RhythmPlayerStateType state, RhythmPlayerReason reason)? onRhythmPlayerStateChanged;
public virtual void OnRhythmPlayerStateChanged(RHYTHM_PLAYER_STATE_TYPE state, RHYTHM_PLAYER_REASON reason)

section.p: When the virtual metronome state changes, the SDK triggers this callback to report the current state. If the metronome encounters an issue, this callback helps you identify the current state and the cause of the issue for troubleshooting.

This callback is triggered when the state of the virtual metronome changes. When the virtual metronome encounters an issue, this callback helps you understand its current state and the reason for the failure, which facilitates troubleshooting.

When the state of the virtual metronome changes, the SDK triggers this callback to report the current state. If a fault occurs with the virtual metronome, this callback helps you understand the current state and the reason for the fault, allowing you to troubleshoot.

This callback is triggered when the virtual metronome state changes. If the virtual metronome encounters a failure, this callback helps you understand the current state and the reason for the failure, facilitating troubleshooting.
section.note: This callback applies to Android and iOS only.
